title: Deep Elf
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

*This page deals with the player race; for those deep elves met as monsters, see [List of deep elves](/List_of_deep_elves "List of deep elves").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | The Deep Elves are a species of Elves who long ago fled the overworld to live in darkness underground. There, they developed their mental powers, evolving a natural gift for all forms of magic, and adapted physically to their new environment, becoming weaker and losing all colouration. They are poor at melee combat and physical defense, although they are capable at using bows in ranged combat. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Equipment and Skills](#Starting_Equipment_and_Skills)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- **[Mana Regeneration](/Mana_Regeneration "Mana Regeneration"):** Deep Elves have double the normal mana regeneration rate.

Deep Elves have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 5, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 12 and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 10 (before Background modifiers). They have two extra base [magic points](/Magic_points "Magic points").

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Mages:** [Hedge Wizard](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard"), [Conjurer](/Conjurer "Conjurer"), [Summoner](/Summoner "Summoner"), [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer"), [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist"), [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist"), [Air Elementalist](/Air_Elementalist "Air Elementalist"), [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist"), [Alchemist](/Alchemist "Alchemist")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") every 4th level.
- 20% less [hit points](/Hit_points "Hit points") than average.
- +4 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.

## Starting Equipment and Skills

Deep Elves receive all the skills and equipment listed for their background.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species")** • [Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species") • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Deep Elves are archetypical "mage" characters - great at all types of magic, but frail. Not complicated, but still moderately difficult to play. Being fragile isn't great in a permadeath game, since this can turn bad situations into perilous ones. So while their magic aptitude is strong in its own right, a prospective Deep Elf should remain vigilant.

They also have a great [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons") aptitude, the best in the game (tied with [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold")), which allows them to be decent [Hunters](/Hunter "Hunter") or [Hexslingers](/Hexslinger "Hexslinger").

## Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

|                [Skill](/Skill "Skill")               | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :--------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                     ***Attack***                     |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|           [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")           |                -2                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                               -2 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                                3 |
|                                                      |                                  |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                                2 |                                                    |                                  |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") |                -3                | [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)") |                               -2 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                                1 |
|                 [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                 |                -2                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                                3 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                                3 |
|           [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")           |                -3                |                                                 |                                  | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                                1 |
|              [Staves](/Staves "Staves")              |                 0                |    [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")    |                                1 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                                2 |
|  [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat")  |                -2                |      [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")     |                                1 | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                                1 |
|           [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")           |                 0                | [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") |                                0 | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                      |                                1 |
|                                                      |                                  |                                                 |                                  | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                                1 |
|     [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")     |                 0                |                                                 |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                                1 |
|       [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")      |                -1                |                                                 |                                  | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                                1 |
|  [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")  |                 3                |      [Experience](/Experience "Experience")     |                               -1 | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                                1 |

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), Deep Elves did not have the [Mana Regeneration](/Mana_Regeneration "Mana Regeneration") mutation, and their [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") aptitude was +0.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), Deep Elves' [Bows](/Bows "Bows") aptitude was only +1.

| [Species](/Species "Species") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| ----------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Simple                        | [Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf") • [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") • [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") • [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") • [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") • [Troll](/Troll "Troll") • [Deep Elf]() • [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") • [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") |
| Intermediate                  | [Human](/Human "Human") • [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold") • [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") • [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") • [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan") • [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul") • [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu") • [Oni](/Oni "Oni") • [Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi")                                |
| Advanced                      | [Coglin](/Coglin "Coglin") • [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") • [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") • [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod") • [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") • [Naga](/Naga "Naga") • [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode") • [Felid](/Felid "Felid") • [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy")           |
html:
Deep Elf

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

This page deals with the player race; for those deep elves met as monsters, see List of deep elves.

The Deep Elves are a species of Elves who long ago fled the overworld to live in darkness underground. There, they developed their mental powers, evolving a natural gift for all forms of magic, and adapted physically to their new environment, becoming weaker and losing all colouration. They are poor at melee combat and physical defense, although they are capable at using bows in ranged combat.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Equipment and Skills
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 History

Innate Abilities

  • Mana Regeneration: Deep Elves have double the normal mana regeneration rate.

Deep Elves have a base Strength of 5, Intelligence of 12 and Dexterity of 10 (before Background modifiers). They have two extra base magic points.

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Mages: Hedge Wizard, Conjurer, Summoner, Necromancer, Fire Elementalist, Ice Elementalist, Air Elementalist, Earth Elementalist, Alchemist

Level Bonuses

  • +1 intelligence every 4th level.
  • 20% less hit points than average.
  • +4 willpower per level.

Starting Equipment and Skills

Deep Elves receive all the skills and equipment listed for their background.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Deep Elves are archetypical "mage" characters - great at all types of magic, but frail. Not complicated, but still moderately difficult to play. Being fragile isn't great in a permadeath game, since this can turn bad situations into perilous ones. So while their magic aptitude is strong in its own right, a prospective Deep Elf should remain vigilant.

They also have a great Ranged Weapons aptitude, the best in the game (tied with Kobold), which allows them to be decent Hunters or Hexslingers.

Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting -2 Armour -2 Spellcasting 3
Dodging 2
Maces & Flails -3 Shields -2 Conjurations 1
Axes -2 Stealth 3 Hexes 3
Polearms -3 Summonings 1
Staves 0 Invocations 1 Necromancy 2
Unarmed Combat -2 Evocations 1 Translocations 1
Throwing 0 Shapeshifting 0 Alchemy 1
Fire Magic 1
Short Blades 0 Ice Magic 1
Long Blades -1 Air Magic 1
Ranged Weapons 3 Experience -1 Earth Magic 1

History

  • Prior to 0.32, Deep Elves did not have the Mana Regeneration mutation, and their Air Magic aptitude was +0.
  • Prior to 0.26, Deep Elves' Bows aptitude was only +1.
Species
Simple Mountain Dwarf • Minotaur • Merfolk • Gargoyle • Draconian • Troll • Deep Elf • Armataur • Gnoll
Intermediate Human • Kobold • Demonspawn • Djinni • Spriggan • Ghoul • Tengu • Oni • Barachi
Advanced Coglin • Vine Stalker • Vampire • Demigod • Formicid • Naga • Octopode • Felid • Mummy

{{version032}}
''This page deals with the player race; for those deep elves met as monsters, see [[List of deep elves]].''
{{flavour|The Deep Elves are a species of Elves who long ago fled the overworld to live in darkness underground. There, they developed their mental powers, evolving a natural gift for all forms of magic, and adapted physically to their new environment, becoming weaker and losing all colouration. They are poor at melee combat and physical defense, although they are capable at using bows in ranged combat.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*'''[[Mana Regeneration]]:''' Deep Elves have double the normal mana regeneration rate.
Deep Elves have a base [[Strength]] of 5, [[Intelligence]] of 12 and [[Dexterity]] of 10 (before Background modifiers). They have two extra base [[magic points]].

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Mages:''' [[Hedge Wizard]], [[Conjurer]], [[Summoner]], [[Necromancer]], [[Fire Elementalist]], [[Ice Elementalist]], [[Air Elementalist]], [[Earth Elementalist]], [[Alchemist]]

==Level Bonuses==
*+1 [[intelligence]] every 4th level.
*20% less [[hit points]] than average.
*+4 [[willpower]] per level.

==Starting Equipment and Skills==
Deep Elves receive all the skills and equipment listed for their background.

==Difficulty of Play==
{{Easy}}

Deep Elves are archetypical "mage" characters - great at all types of magic, but frail. Not complicated, but still moderately difficult to play. Being fragile isn't great in a permadeath game, since this can turn bad situations into perilous ones. So while their magic aptitude is strong in its own right, a prospective Deep Elf should remain vigilant.

They also have a great [[Ranged Weapons]] aptitude, the best in the game (tied with [[Kobold]]), which allows them to be decent [[Hunter]]s or [[Hexslinger]]s.

{{species_aptitudes|Deep Elf}}

==History==
*Prior to [[0.32]], Deep Elves did not have the [[Mana Regeneration]] mutation, and their [[Air Magic]] aptitude was +0.
*Prior to [[0.26]], Deep Elves' [[Bows]] aptitude was only +1.

{{species}}

[[Category:Elf]]
